awards.title: Best Paper Award 2nd Price - Best Research Articles Published in Agricultural Economics Research Review
awards.description:
Dr. R. T. Doshi Foundation Awards

Dr. Doshi Foundation, Mumbai awards every year two prizes for the best articles published in the one volume of Agricultural Economics Research Review and two prizes for the best paper presentation during the Annual Conference of AERA (India) since 1999. 

"The awards include a certificate and a cash prize and are presented during the Annual General Meeting of the Society. These awards are decided based on the recommendations of separate panels of experts."

http://www.aeraindia.in/Awards.html
awards.issuer: Dr. R. T. Doshi Foundation Awards

awards.title: 2006   AFMA R&D Paper Award and National Best R&D Paper Award (2nd place- Socio-economic Category)- Spatial Econometric Analysis of Fresh Fish Demand in the Philippines
awards.description:
NRS is an annually-coordinated event by BAR in its efforts to provide and update cutting-edge technologies and information in agriculture and fisheries R&D. Likewise, the activity hopes to encourage more scientists and researchers to take a more proactive role in generating technologies that could transform our farmers and fisherfolk into globally-competitive business entrepreneurs.

Each winner of the AFMA Best R&D Paper award received P20,000 and a trophy while first and second runners up received P15, 000 and P 10,000 and trophies, respectively.

http://www.bar.gov.ph/chronicle-home/archives-list/176-october-2006-issue/2568-bar-concludes-18th-nrs-afmabest-r-d-papers-and-posters-awarded
awards.issuer: The Bureau of Agricultural Research (BAR)- National Research Symposium (NRS)

certifications.name: SAS Certified Advanced Programmer for SAS 9

projects.title: Spatial Linear Approximate to Almost Ideal Demand System
projects.description: This project showcases my being proactive, for taking initiative of generating ideas and to be able to convert that idea into a concrete finish product – a contribution to the scientific literature.  The project requires considerable quant skills and knowledge in advance SAS programming. Variants of the Linear Approximate to Almost Ideal Demand System (LA/AIDS) model with habit formation are formulated. In the empirical application of the models, I used a combination of Integrated Matrix Language (IML) and Econometric & Time Series (ETS) SAS modules. To enhance visualization and interpretation, Geographic Information System (GIS) tools are applied.

profile_positions.description:
• Timely production of periodic and ad hoc management as well as risk-related reports

•  Contribute in the development and operationalization as well as provide/update technical documentation of these reports (e.g.:
     • risk exposure, 
     • production- and financial- margin calculations,    
     • calculation of loan-loss provision and cost of risk, 
     • monitoring and control of collateral values both from properties and buildup savings of pledged policies

•  Efficient management of the company’s data warehouse. 
    • Controlling and safeguarding of data quality; Process the data coming from third party systems (service providers, different insurance companies)
    • Identify shortfalls in data quality against business rules and propose improvements
    • Contact to internal clients and liaise with mid-office and compliance department as well as service providers to continuously discuss and improve data quality and data processes.

• Render technical assistance to colleagues
profile_positions.title: Reporting Analyst -Datawarehouse Administrator

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Econometrician / Researcher

profile_positions.description:
•  Assists Supervisors in implementing projects
•  Research on 
   o    Empirics of Growth theory
   o    Macro-econometric models for the evaluation of the Structural Funds of the European Union
   o    Spatial Econometrics
   o     Productivity and Efficiency Analysis
   o     Regional and sectoral economic studies
profile_positions.title: Researcher / PHD Student

profile_positions.description:
• Contributed to the development and application of Research Priority Setting Methods and Monitoring & Evaluation Tools 
• Carried out data processing as well as economic and econometric modeling in accordance to project objectives and needs
• Contributed to the conceptualization, implementation and documentation of methodologies/frameworks
• Drafted scientific papers for submission to international journals
• Contributed to the preparation of project reports for submission to project donors
• Provided technical support to- and collaborate with- project partners from various countries including colleagues from HQ and outreach offices
• Supervised research assistants involved in different projects in coordination with project leaders
• Organized and conducted training workshops (e.g., data processing and econometric modeling)
• Compiled relevant references and conduct literature review
• Contributed to the development and parameterization of the Asia-Fish Model, a multiproduct equilibrium model for disaggregated analysis of fish demand, supply and trade.
profile_positions.title: From Senior Research Assistant to Senior Research Analyst

profile_positions.description:
•  Developed and Managed a database of the Integrated Pest management project (IPM)
•  Undertook data processing as well as economic econometric modeling
profile_positions.title: Research Programmer

profile_positions.description:
•   Developed a data entry and retrieval system for all the projects being implemented by the Foundation
•  Supervised several research scholars (interns) working with the Foundation on data entry and retrieval and rendered technical support on data processing and analyses
•  Supervised/administered rural rapid appraisal surveys in various research sites in the Philippines
•  Conducted econometric analysis on the benchmark (1993) and midstream (1995) data of the Grains Production and Enhancement Program (GPEP), collected by the Bureau of Agricultural Statistics (BAS)
•  Assisted in the implementation of a proto-type Project Benefit and Monitoring System (PBMS)
•  Assumed the responsibility of a computer technician of the Foundation on trouble-shooting and installation of software/packages
profile_positions.title: Part-time Research Programmer/Statistician

profile_positions.description:
•  Coordinated a team on a two-year project entitled “Socio-economic Evaluation of Farmer Decision-Making Among IPM Farmer Field School Graduates” in Central Philippines (Iloilo)
•   Developed and managed the data entry and retrieval system of the project.
•  Wrote programs for data retrieval, data validation, generation of summary statistics and econometric modeling
•   Assisted the project leader in the preparation of reports for submission to FAO
•  Maintained a collection of journal articles and related materials
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•  Administered rural rapid appraisal surveys in various sites in the Philippines. Duties include:
o  Coordination with local government offices (i.e. Provincial offices of Department of Labor, National Statistics Office, etc) and village leaders
o  Formation and supervision of several site-specific groups of enumerators
•  Conducted data processing 
•  Drafted profile report for each site visited to be incorporated in the final report for submission to the donor
